alert.note: Alert for Collin; Cooke; Denton; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 12:59AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Denton, northwestern Collin, southeastern Cooke and southern Grayson Counties through 145 AM CST... At 1257 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gunter and another over Ray Roberts Lake. Both storms are moving east northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Sanger, Anna, Celina, Pilot Point, Van Alstyne, Howe, Collinsville, Whitewright, Gunter, Bells, Tom Bean, Dorchester, Ray Roberts Park Isle Du Bois, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Lake Kiowa, Valley Lake, Tioga, Road Runner and Valley View. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 479 and 490. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
